detail_description: Nestled near the ancient Tiberius Bridge lies one of Rimini's most enchanting spots: Borgo San Giuliano. This historic neighborhood, once home to fishermen and artisans, is a delightful maze of narrow streets and charming squares that exude an old-world charm reminiscent of Federico Fellini’s films like "Clowns" and "Amarcord." While the area has evolved from its humble beginnings—no longer featuring crumbling walls but instead adorned with vibrant pastel colors—the essence remains intact.
name: Murales del borgo San Giuliano

excerpt: 15th-century castle featuring a semi-weekly market, along with exhibitions & events.
detail_description: Castel Sismondo is a 15th-century fortress located in piazza Malatesta, named after Sigismondo Pandolfo Malatesta, the lord of Rimini at that time. The castle has been revitalized to become a cultural hub and hosts a semi-weekly market, exhibitions, and events.
name: Castel Sismondo

excerpt: Main square with a fountain, the statue of Pope Paul V, an 1840s theater & the old fish market.
detail_description: Piazza Cavour is the vibrant heart of Rimini, surrounded by magnificent buildings and monuments. The square features the Palazzo dell'Arengo, Palazzo del Podesta, a statue of Pope Paul V, the historic Theatre Galli, and the iconic Fountain of the Pigna. On one side stands the old Fish Market with its charming stone counters and fish-cleaning fountains.
name: Piazza Cavour

detail_description: Ponte di Tiberio is a 2,000-year-old bridge in Rimini that stands as a remarkable relic of Roman architecture. It is located at the end of a canal running from the beach through to Parco XXV Aprile. The bridge, also known as the Bridge of Augustus, was constructed in 20 BC and remains in excellent condition. Nearby attractions include the Renaissance cathedral of Tempio Malatestiano and Borgo San Giuliano.
name: Ponte di Tiberio

detail_description: Piazza Tre Martiri, also known as the Three Martyrs Piazza, is a historic and vibrant square located in the heart of Rimini. It has been witness to significant moments in the city's history and is surrounded by important buildings. At one end, you can find the impressive Tempietto di Sant Antonio and Chiesa Dei Paolotti, while at the other end there are fantastic shops, high-quality restaurants, and cafes.
name: Piazza Tre Martiri

excerpt: Rimini is a city on the Adriatic coast, in Italy’s Emilia-Romagna region. It's known for its beachside nightclubs and shallow waters. South of the center, the Malatestiano Temple is a 15th-century reconstruction of an old Franciscan church, now a mausoleum for Sigismondo Pandolfo Malatesta, a local nobleman. Nearby, the Malatesta-built Castel Sismondo is a medieval fortress now used for cultural events.
detail_description: Rimini, located on the Adriatic coast in Italy's Emilia-Romagna region, is renowned for its vibrant beachside nightclubs and shallow waters. The city boasts historical landmarks such as the 15th-century Malatestiano Temple and the medieval fortress Castel Sismondo. Rimini is also a member of the Club of the Most Beautiful Italian Villages, dedicated to preserving the heritage of small Italian towns.
name: Rimini

detail_description: Opened in 2021, the Fellini Museum is a vast complex dedicated to Federico Fellini and his artistic legacy. Divided into three sections, it offers an immersive journey through the filmmaker's imagination. The Palazzo del Fulgor features interactive tools and captivating visuals across three floors. Meanwhile, the Sigismondo Castle presents multimedia installations evoking fragments of Fellini's movie sets and shooting techniques.
name: Fellini Museum
address: Castel Sismondo, Piazza Malatesta, 47921 Rimini RN, Italy

excerpt: Local heritage museum exhibiting ancient surgical tools, medieval art, fashion illustrations & more.
detail_description: The City Museum in Rimini is a treasure trove of historical artifacts and artworks. The museum showcases ancient surgical tools, medieval art, fashion illustrations, and more. Visitors can explore the new archaeological section featuring exceptional surgical instruments found in the House. The Art Gallery within the museum displays an array of paintings, sculptures, ceramics, tapestries, and jewelry including masterpieces from the Rimini school of the fourteenth century.
name: City Museum
address: Via Luigi Tonini, 1, 47921 Rimini RN, Italy

excerpt: Seaside theme park aimed at younger children with rides, water games & a seafood buffet restaurant.
detail_description: Fiabilandia is a renowned amusement park in Italy, established in 1965 and catering to family tourism. It offers specially designed attractions for children, ensuring delightful experiences for families. The park features over 30 attractions, including thrilling rides, water games, and educational trails set within five thematic areas: Far West, Medieval, Oriental, The Pirate Bay, and the Magic Village.
name: Fiabilandia
address: Via Gerolamo Cardano, 15, 47924 Rivazzurra RN, Italy

excerpt: Excavated remains of a 2nd-century villa, with mosaic floors & finds in the adjoining City Museum.
detail_description: The Domus del Chirurgo, also known as the Surgeons House, is a fascinating archaeological site in Rimini that has been open to the public since 2007. This ancient villa dates back to the 2nd century and offers visitors a glimpse into its well-preserved mosaic floors and historical artifacts. The highlight of this site is the discovery of an imperial residence that once housed a medical taberna, where over 150 surgical instruments were found, providing insight into ancient medical practices.
name: Domus del Chirurgo
address: Piazza Luigi Ferrari, 47921 Rimini RN, Italy

detail_description: Teatro Amintore Galli, located in Piazza Cavour, is a historic theater that has been meticulously restored to its original 19th-century grandeur after being destroyed by a WWII bomb. The neoclassical interior boasts Greek-Roman-style columns, classical capitals, and an elegant gold and ivory color scheme. Today, the theater hosts a variety of performances including opera, classical music, drama, and dance.
name: Teatro Amintore Galli

excerpt: Iconic theater dedicated to Fellini offering films & cultural events in an ornate Art Nouveau space.
detail_description: Cinema Fulgor is a renowned theater in Rimini, known for its dedication to Fellini and offering a variety of films and cultural events within an ornate Art Nouveau space. The Piazza Malatesta, overlooking the castle, has undergone interventions as part of a larger project connecting the Roman and Renaissance eras in Rimini. This area has been transformed into the Piazza dei Sogni of the Museum dedicated to Federico Fellini, featuring installations evoking Fellini's vision.
name: Cinema Fulgor

excerpt: Built in 27 BCE, the country's oldest surviving triumphal arch marks the gateway to the city center.
detail_description: The Arco di Augusto, dating back to 27 BCE, is the oldest surviving triumphal arch in Italy and serves as the monumental gateway to Rimini's historic center. Originally marking the end of the Via Flaminia, a consular road connecting Rome with ancient Ariminum, this towering structure features carvings of Roman deities such as Apollo and Jupiter. Despite additions made in the 10th century, elements of its original decor remain intact.
name: Arco di Augusto

detail_description: Rimini Beach Arena is the premier summer event venue in Riviera Romagnola, situated on the southern Rimini seaside. It hosts a continuous music festival featuring top international artists, drawing young people from across Europe. The arena offers various food and beverage services and is easily accessible by public or private transport. Rimini itself is a diverse city with beaches, hills, mountains, and charming Borghi. Visitors praise its modern facilities, friendly service, and picturesque surroundings.
name: Rimini Beach Arena
address: Viale Principe di Piemonte, 56/62, 47924 Rimini RN, Italy

detail_description: Nestled just a stone's throw away, Borgo San Giuliano is a charming slice of Rimini's history that captivates visitors with its vibrant atmosphere. Once a humble fishing village on the northern banks of the Marecchia River, this delightful area has transformed into a hidden gem along the Adriatic Riviera. In fact, it narrowly escaped demolition in the late 1970s when plans were made to replace it with modern residential developments.
name: Borgo San Giuliano

detail_description: Vecchia Pescheria, located in the historic center of Rimini, is a vibrant nightlife hub with a rich history. Once an old fish market, it now houses various pubs and clubs where visitors can enjoy drinks and dining. The area also features attractions like the renovated Teatro Galli and the Federico Fellini International Museum. The Old Fish Market itself, built in 1747, stands as a testament to Rimini's fishing industry.
name: Vecchia Pescheria

excerpt: Panoramic sea, marina & city views from a Ferris wheel set on the beach on a small peninsula.
detail_description: Located on a small peninsula in Rimini, Italy, La Ruota Panoramica offers breathtaking views of the sea, marina, and city from its impressive 55-meter-tall Ferris wheel. The slow-moving cabins provide a leisurely 20-minute journey with ample opportunities to capture aerial shots of the beach and possibly even spot the Republic of San Marino in the distance. This iconic attraction is a must-see while visiting Rimini, especially for stunning panoramas during the evenings.
name: La Ruota Panoramica
address: L.go Ruggero Boscovich, 47921 Rimini RN, Italy

excerpt: Park dedicated to the namesake filmmaker, with a camera sculpture & "Fountain of the Four Horses".
detail_description: Parco Federico Fellini, located in Rimini, is a park dedicated to the renowned filmmaker. The park features a camera sculpture and the 'Fountain of the Four Horses.' It offers a relaxing atmosphere with elegant sculptures, shaded areas, and a pleasant promenade. Visitors can also find a children's playground within the park.
name: Parco Federico Fellini
address: de Fosses, Via Saint Maur des Fosses, 47921 Rimini RN, Italy

excerpt: San Giuliano a Mare's Marina Centro is dominated by the Marina di Rimini, a vast, modern harbor in the Adriatic Sea where an elevated promenade overlooks sailboats and luxury yachts. The Arena Lido hosts summertime open-air film screenings and concerts. Steps away, sandy and pet-friendly Lido San Giuliano draws families to its playground, while beach bars, restaurants, and kiosks offer refreshments day and night.
detail_description: Marina Centro, located in San Giuliano a Mare, is a vibrant area dominated by the modern Marina di Rimini. The harbor offers stunning views of sailboats and luxury yachts from an elevated promenade. During summer, Arena Lido hosts open-air film screenings and concerts while nearby Lido San Giuliano attracts families with its sandy beach and pet-friendly facilities.
name: Marina Centro

detail_description: Rimini Street Market, located in the heart of Rimini, is a bustling hub for locals and tourists alike. With over 60 stalls offering an array of goods from fresh Adriatic fish caught just hours earlier to locally grown fruits and vegetables, this market is a treasure trove for food enthusiasts. In addition to food items, visitors can also find clothing, shoes, accessories, and various other goods at reasonable prices.
name: Rimini Street Market

detail_description: Corso d'Augusto is home to the imposing Arch of Augustus, a significant monument that was moved from its original location at the end of Via Flaminia. In 1935, a decree was issued to elevate its prominence, leading to the swift demolition of surrounding buildings. Today, this arch stands as one of Rimini's iconic symbols and is prominently featured on the city's coat of arms.
name: Corso d'Augusto

excerpt: 13th-century church reconstructed in 15th century as a mausoleum for Sigismondo Pandolfo Malatesta.
detail_description: Nestled in the heart of Rimini, the Malatestiano Temple is a stunning 13th-century church that underwent significant reconstruction in the 15th century to serve as a mausoleum for Sigismondo Pandolfo Malatesta. This architectural marvel showcases an impressive marble facade inspired by the Arch of Augustus, crafted by renowned architect Leon Battista Alberti.
name: Malatestiano Temple
address: Via IV Novembre, 35, 47900 Rimini RN, Italy

detail_description: Rimini Caput Viarum is a historical attraction that has been restored and converted into a small museum, showcasing the ancient history of Ariminum. Housed in a deconsecrated church, this information center offers an insightful look into Rimini's past through engaging tools and informative displays. Visitors can explore the birth and splendor of Roman Rimini with the help of friendly staff who are available to provide historical and touristic information.
name: aRimini Caput Viarum

excerpt: Large park featuring a playground & fitness equipment, plus walking paths & wooded areas.
detail_description: Parco XXV Aprile, also known as Parco Marecchia, is Rimini's largest green space, covering 234,790 square meters. It was created when the Marecchia river was diverted from its original course to prevent flooding. The park features walking paths, wooded areas, a playground, and fitness equipment. Visitors can enjoy stunning sunset views with the Tiberius Bridge reflecting in the Marecchia River while having a picnic.
name: Parco XXV Aprile

excerpt: Beach bars and restaurants overlooking the Adriatic Sea and the marina line the waterfront of San Giuliano a Mare. Hotels surround leafy Briolini Park, while murals can be found along the walkway of Lungofiume degli Artisti by the River Marecchia. North of the Tiberius Bridge, the enduring Borgo San Giuliano area is home to the 16th-century Church of San Giuliano Martire and the biennial Festa de Borg street fair.
detail_description: San Giuliano Mare offers a charming coastal experience with its beach bars and restaurants that offer stunning views of the Adriatic Sea and the marina. The area is surrounded by hotels near the leafy Briolini Park, while vibrant murals adorn the walkway along Lungofiume degli Artisti by the River Marecchia.
name: San Giuliano Mare

detail_description: Marina di Rimini (Darsena) is a must-visit destination in Rimini, especially during the summer. This upscale district in Rimini harbor offers deluxe restaurants, lavish yachts, and stunning sunset views towards the famous Rimini panoramic Ferris Wheel. Visitors can take a boat trip from here and even have the opportunity to sail. The area is perfect for a romantic evening stroll with your partner.
name: Marina di Rimini (Darsena)

detail_description: The Arco d'Augusto, situated at the end of Rimini's main street, is a significant historical landmark dating back to 27 BC. It was constructed in honor of Emperor Caesar Augustus and originally featured his statue atop the gateway. Despite enduring various weather conditions over time, including rain, this ancient arch has remained standing tall. With its wide opening symbolizing an era of peace following conflicts, it stands as the oldest Roman triumphal arch in northern Italy.
name: Arco d'Augusto

detail_description: Piazza Cavour is a vibrant and bustling square at the heart of Rimini's historic center. It attracts both locals and tourists, offering a lively atmosphere with its proximity to significant museums and monuments. The square embodies the diverse elements of Rimini, creating an intriguing blend that adds to its appeal as a top attraction in the area.
name: Piazza Cavour

detail_description: Ala Nuova - Museo della Città, located in an old convent near Ponte di Tiberio and Piazza Tre Martiri, is a treasure trove for history enthusiasts. The museum houses an impressive collection of 1500 artifacts and relics spanning from prehistoric times to the present day. Additionally, the contemporary wing of the museum serves as a remarkable exhibition space, making it a must-visit for those interested in archaeology and ancient history.
name: Ala Nuova - Museo della Città

detail_description: Bagno 38 Egisto is a fantastic beach that offers a mix of tradition, history, and modern amenities. The sandy beach and shallow sea make it perfect for family swimming in the summer or romantic walks in the evening. The whole area is well-maintained with staff constantly picking up litter to keep it clean. There are comfortable sunbeds and umbrellas available for rent at a reasonable price. Additionally, there are clean toilets and various local vendors offering food and drinks.
name: Bagno 38 Egisto
address: Viale Giuliano Dati, 113H, 47922 Viserba RN, Italy

detail_description: Bagno 10 Vatikaki is a perfect spot for a relaxing day by the sea, offering endless opportunities for fun and leisure. The beach provides various activities such as water sports and a kids' playground, making it an ideal destination for families. With its soft sands and inviting waters, this beach is the ultimate escape on warm summer days. Additionally, visitors can enjoy amenities like sunbeds, umbrellas, toilets, and restaurants.
name: Bagno 10 Vatikaki
address: Viale Paolo Toscanelli altezza Via XXV Marzo Rivabella, 47921 Rimini RN, Italy

detail_description: Beach 33 Rimini ⛱️ Dog Welcome offers extraordinary hospitality typical of the Romagna Riviera. The staff, led by Pino, goes out of their way to ensure a comfortable stay for guests and their furry friends. The beach provides all amenities for dogs including drinking bowls and showers. There's a nearby restaurant and ample space for dogs to swim in the sea before it gets crowded.
name: Beach 33 Rimini ⛱️ Dog Welcome
address: Lungomare Augusto Murri, 4, 47921 Rimini RN, Italy

detail_description: The Statua di Giulio Cesare, located in Piazza Tre Martiri in Rimini's historic center, is a significant historical landmark. Positioned on the northern side of the square, this large bronze monument portrays Julius Caesar facing Rome. It is believed that he spoke his famous phrase "the die is cast" from this very spot before initiating an attack on Rome.
name: Statua di Giulio Cesare

detail_description: The Torre dell'Orologio, a 15th-century clock tower located in Piazza Cavour, is a must-see landmark in Rimini. This iconic structure has undergone several renovations and restorations over the years, with its most recent one in 1933. The tower features Renaissance architecture and houses a clock dating back to 1562, along with a perpetual calendar adorned with terracotta tiles depicting zodiac signs, months, and moon phases.
name: Torre dell'Orologio
address: Piazza Tre Martiri, 42, 47921 Rimini RN, Italy

detail_description: Marebello, situated in the southern zone alongside Bellariva, Rivazzurra, and Miramare, offers an ideal setting for both young adults and families. Positioned only a short distance from Riccione, this vibrant area provides convenient transportation options such as buses and shuttles to access the popular nightclubs scattered along the Riviera. With its attractive location and diverse appeal, Marebello serves as a great destination for individuals seeking youthful excitement or family-friendly experiences alike.
name: Marebello

detail_description: Rivazzurra, located in Rimini, is a popular holiday destination known for its entertainment options and family-friendly atmosphere. The Caribbean Hotel in Rivazzurra offers professional and comprehensive entertainment for guests, including children's activities such as games, dancing, workshops, and aqua gym. The area also boasts Ristorante Auriga, a well-reviewed restaurant offering a nice atmosphere and great food.
name: Rivazzurra

detail_description: Viserba is set to welcome a new gingerbread-themed ice cream parlor called Pan di Zenzero, a unique addition among the many accommodations in Rimini. The idea comes from the Pari family, who have been gelato makers and pastry chefs for 51 years at the historic Caffe Matisse in Viserba. The project is driven by Claudia and her family, who have nurtured this dream for about five years.
name: Viserba

detail_description: Porta Galliana is a charming and newly popular spot in Rimini, nestled near a 12th-century city gate that once connected the city to its port area along the Marecchia River. The site boasts a beautiful garden, night lights, and an inviting atmosphere. Visitors can enjoy piadina in the shade of lovely trees without needing to make reservations.
name: Porta Galliana
address: Via Bastioni Settentrionali, 47921 Rimini RN, Italy

name: Fellini Museum Palazzo del Fulgor
address: Via Giuseppe Verdi, 16, 47921 Rimini RN, Italy

detail_description: Nestled in the heart of Rimini, Italy, Cuor di Cioccolato is a delightful gelato shop that stands out for its artisanal approach to ice cream. This charming spot offers an array of unique flavors crafted from top-notch ingredients, including intriguing combinations like chocolate ginger and Modica chocolate crumbs. The pistachio flavor hails from Bronte, Sicily, ensuring authenticity and richness in every scoop.
name: Cuor di Cioccolato
address: Via Circonvallazione Meridionale, 1/3, 47923 Rimini RN, Italy

excerpt: Flanked by the ancient city wall, this leafy public space has a cycle path, sculptures & benches.
name: Parco Alcide Cervi
address: Via Bastioni Orientali, 47921 Rimini RN, Italy

detail_description: Piazzetta Gregorio da Rimini is home to the oldest bookshop in town, offering a treasure trove of rare and out-of-print books that will delight any literature enthusiast.
name: Piazzetta Gregorio da Rimini

detail_description: Rivabella is a peaceful seaside district located in northern Rimini, just a short distance from the city center. The area boasts fine sandy beaches and shallow waters, making it perfect for family vacations. Rivabella's beach staff are dedicated to ensuring a relaxing experience for visitors, offering delicious meals and entertainment options such as dance evenings and wine tastings. Additionally, the district is known for its two springs with water believed to have medicinal properties.
name: Rivabella

detail_description: Gelateria La Romana, established in 1947 in the heart of Rimini, offers a wide range of high-quality flavors created with creativity and a few available ingredients. The shop is known for its unique Caramello Salato con Crema di Nocciola al Cioccolato Bianco flavor combination. It's a popular spot, often crowded with both locals and tourists enjoying their gelato outside or at the nearby park.
name: Gelateria La Romana
address: Piazza Luigi Ferrari, 5, 47921 Rimini RN, Italy

detail_description: Chiesa Parrocchiale di Santa Maria Maddalena, also known as Chiesa dei Servi, is a Catholic church situated in the historic city center of Rimini, Italy. It was constructed by the Servants of Mary religious order in the 14th century. The church has a modern style and is well-maintained with good capacity. It is located near parking facilities and has been praised for its organization by parish priests and volunteers.
name: Chiesa Parrocchiale di Santa Maria Maddalena

detail_description: Viale Regina Elena is home to Hotel Villa Augustea, which boasts a stunning private swimming pool that overlooks the seafront. Positioned directly in front of the beaches, it enjoys ample sunshine throughout the day. This exclusive feature sets it apart from other hotels along Viale Regina Elena, where smaller pools are more common.
name: Viale Regina Elena

detail_description: Begin your exploration of Rimini at the iconic Arco d'Augusto, situated in the city center. This ancient Roman arch, over 2000 years old, holds the distinction of being Italy's oldest surviving arch. It offers a captivating glimpse into Rimini's rich history and provides an immersive experience in the city's millennia-old heritage.
name: Arco d'Augusto

detail_description: Embark on a customizable adventure in Valmarecchia, where you can explore the region by bike, car, or public transport. Immerse yourself in the area's rich offerings including flavorsome cuisine, exquisite wines, and high-quality extra virgin oils. Marvel at the rugged rock formations and be captivated by the breathtaking panoramic vistas that this picturesque destination has to offer.
name: Valmarecchia

detail_description: Vicolo Gomma is a charming and picturesque alleyway located in the heart of an old Italian town. Lined with historic buildings, colorful murals, and quaint cafes, this narrow street exudes a timeless ambiance that transports visitors to another era. The cobblestone pathway and traditional architecture add to the area's allure, making it a popular spot for leisurely strolls and photo opportunities.
name: Vicolo Gomma
